title: Search
description_short: A simple search engine in Java that calculates relevance using the pagerank algorithm. Can quickly index large corpuses and deliver instant query results.
description_long: Executed the Page Rank algorithm for a search engine
Preprocessed XML files containing the corpus
Parsed, tokenized, and stemmed user input
Indexed a corpus with 5,000 pages in 8 minutes

title: RedWood
description_short: A smart contract written in Solidity that allows a user to swap different assets at an algorithmically determined price without the need for a trusted third party.
description_long: Wrote smart contracts in Solidity for a decentralized exchange.
Implemented liquidity pool functionality so that more tokens could be added to the exchange
Utilized a local Ethereum development blockchain to ensure minimal gas was consumed during deployment
Unit tested with mocha framework

title: Shell
description_short: A user-friendly C shell eqipped with job control and features like error checking, example command usage, and signal forwarding.
description_long: Implemented a basic job control system -- where processes could run in the background while still allowing signal forwarding
Handled basic commands in addition to prompting the user with example usages and error checking

title: Recommendation System
description_short: A recommendation system in Java designed for to suggest student groups based on aggregated student data from multiple API endpoints and a SQL database
description_long: Aggregated student data from multiple API endpoints and a SQL database to populate qualitative and quantitave data structures
Generated a list of similar students by combining results from Bloom filters and a k-d tree

title: BrunoCoin
description_short: A simple cryptocurrency designed to run on one machine in a multithreaded environment and written in GoLang
description_long: Designed and wrote functionality for the blockchain, miners, and wallets
Implemented transaction functionality between wallets
Broadcasated transactions/blocks to the network
Mined transactions and validated blocks

title: Screen Reader
description_short: A screen reading application in Typescript that makes web pages accessible for those with a visual disability. Includes navigation modalities and speed control.
description_long: Implemented keyboard control commands for speed, pausing, and navigation
Included location awareness by reading the current node location on demand
Added four-directional navigation through HTML tables
Handled links and input fields while allowing users to continue reading
